name: With New Rain on the Way, Sandbags Still Available
description: With forecasters predicting more heavy rains across San Diego County Monday and Tuesday, the County and CAL FIRE continue to offer free sand and bags to people in unincorporated communities.

affiliation.name: County of San Diego Communications Office

articleContent:
Reading Time:  3 minutesWith forecasters predicting more heavy rains across San Diego County Monday and Tuesday, the County and CAL FIRE continue to offer free sand and bags to people in unincorporated communities.
Residents in the incorporated cities can find where to get sandbags in their cities on Alertsandiego.org.  
Last week’s historic rains caused flood damage to many homes and businesses, increasing the potential for new flooding if rains are heavy again this week.
Rain can cause flooding and erosion, particularly in areas that are not covered by plants, landscaping, grass and trees. Rain runoff can sweep topsoil, mud, plant material and debris off land and downstream where it can damage homes, clog culverts and storm drains, and flood and damage roadways.
Some fire stations have sand and bags. Others have bags alone. Some stations may have a limited supply. The lists of stations where residents in unincorporated communities can get them are listed below.
People should call ahead to double-check availability and remember to bring a shovel to fill the bags.
Sand and bags

Bonita: Bonita-Sunnyside Fire Station #38: 4900 Bonita Road, Bonita, CA 91902, P: 619-479-2346
Boulevard: Boulevard Fire Station #47: 40080 Ribbonwood Road, Boulevard, CA 91905, P: 619-390-2020

Residents are encouraged to visit AlertSanDiego.org for information on what to do during an emergency, tips on how to prepare for a disaster, and find resources about recovery efforts.
You may also want to check out this how-to video, “You’ve Got Your Sandbags, Now What?” that explains how to properly fill and use sandbags to protect your property.
